isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - "SOLID STATE" GLOW PLUG ANALYSIS GUIDE - TROUBLE SHOOTING GUIDE

para.emph: Follow the instructions contained in Form No. CGED-470-* "Solid State' Glow Plug System Troubleshooting Guide" when confronted with a system malfunction. CGED-470-* is divided into two (2) sections which relate to customer concerns: "HARD STARTING WITH ENGINE COLD" Figure 6.3 and "DASH WAIT LIGHT OPERATION" Figure 6.4.

figure.caption: Figure 6.3 "Solid State" Glow Plug System Troubleshooting Guide (Front) CGED-470-*
Figure 6.4 "Solid State" Glow Plug System Troubleshooting Guide (Rear) CGED-470-*

caution.para: NEVER BYPASS THE TIMED PULSE FUNCTION OF THE GLOW PLUG SYSTEM. CONSTANT 12V CURRENT TO THE GLOW PLUGS WILL CAUSE THEM TO OVERHEAT AND FAIL, POSSIBLY RESULTING IN SEVERE ENGINE DAMAGE.

svcsubproc.title: TEST A. CHECK GLOW PLUGS
svcsubproc.para: Diagnose hard starting with a cold engine, as follows:

entry.para:
TEST:•
Ignition switch off and leads removed from
• Check continuity between glow plug terminal

para.emph: and ground with glow plugs installed in Engine.
Replace defective plugs, then continue w/Test B

note.para: Record the results by placing a check mark in the appropriate box after checking each cylinder. The glow plug is good if the reading is 5 ohm or less. If the glow plug is electrically open (more than 5 ohm), replace the defective plug(s). Go to Test B.

entry.para:
TEST:•
Ignition switch off and leads removed from
• Squeeze sides of protective cover and remove
• Check continuity between each glow plug lead

para.emph: and test terminal of control unit Figure 6.8.
Replace any lead out of spec. repair or replace

figure.caption: Figure 6.6 Glow Plug Control Unit and Harness Location [S-Series Vehicles]
Figure 6.7 Glow Plug Control Unit and Harness Location [1000, 3000, and 4000 Series Vehicles]

note.para: Record the results by placing a check mark in the appropriate box after checking each glow plug lead. Any lead which is more than 1 ohm requires repair of that lead or replacement of the harness, as required. After repairs or replacement reconnect the leads and go to Test C.

figure.caption: Figure 6.8 Control Unit w/Cover Removed (Test Terminal Identification)

svcsubproc.title: TEST C. CHECK CONTROL UNIT GROUND

entry.para: • Connect ohm meter to ground wire

svcsubproc.title: TEST E. CHECK VOLTAGE FROM IGNITION SWITCH

para.emph: E. CHECK VOLTAGE FROM IGNITION SWITCH

entry.para: TEST:• Connect voltmeter to Ignition terminal
• Turn Ignition switch ON, ALL accessories OFF.

para.emph: Check fuse (Fig. 6.12 & 6.13) repair wiring or recharge battery

figure.caption: Figure 6.9 Ground Wire Terminal Eyelet Identification
Figure 6.10 Power terminal and Ground Identification
Figure 6.11 Ignition Terminal and Ground Identification
Figure 6.12 Fuse Block [All S-Series and 1000 and 3000 Series vehicles]

svcsubproc.title: TEST F. FUNCTIONAL TEST

entry.para: TEST:• With Ignition switch off , connect 12

para.emph: volt test light to test terminal on control

entry.para: • Position test light so it can be viewed
• Turn ignition switch on and monitor system operation.
• Compare test light times to test light chart.

note.para: Total Test Light "ON" Times includes initial "ON" and the ON-OFF CYCLES measured in seconds.
For Glow Plug Controller P/N 1 811 059 C91 (Fig. 6.15)

entry.para: For Glow Plug Controller P/N 1 811 059 C92 (Fig. 6.15)
*Temperature of Control Unit, NOT ambient temperature.

note.para: The Dash Wait Light and/or Test Light may not illuminate if engine temperature is at or near normal operating temperature.

figure.caption: Figure 6.14 12 Volt Test Light at Test Terminal

svcsubproc.para: When troubleshooting the problems of: DASH WAIT LIGHT stays on or NO DASH WAIT LIGHT, test the dash wait light operation as follows:
